node.title: Part of a cliff collapses over a lake in Brazil, killing at least six â€“ 20 people still missing
node.alt: Aerial view of Furnas Lake and the cliff face before it collapsed on the boaters. File photo from September 2021.
node.description: Pleasure boats carrying dozens of passengers were drifting near a waterfall on Brazil's Furnas Lake when the cliff face above them disintegrated and fell.
node.content:
["A towering slab of rock has broken from a cliff and toppled onto pleasure boaters drifting near a waterfall on a Brazilian lake, killing at least six people, according to officials.", "Edgard Estevo, commander of the Minas Gerais State Fire Department, said at a news conference on Saturday, local time,\u00a0that, in addition to the dead, as many as 20 people might be missing and officials were seeking to identify them.", "Officials said at least 32 people were injured, though most had been released from hospitals by evening.", "Video images showed a gathering of small boats moving slowly near the sheer rock cliff on Furnas Lake as\u00a0a fissure appeared in the rock and a huge piece toppled onto at least two of the vessels.", "", "
The Brazilian Navy is investigating the cause of the cliff collapse.(AP: Andre Penner/File photo)
", "Mr Estevo said the accident occurred between the towns of Sao Jose da Barra and Capitolio, from where\u00a0the boats had left.", "The press office of Minas Gerais state said the fire department had deployed divers and helicopters to help.", "Minas Gerais Governor Romeu Zema sent messages of solidarity with the victims via social media.", "Furnas Lake \u2014 which was created in 1958 for the installation of a hydroelectric plant \u2014\u00a0is a popular tourist drawcard\u00a0in the area and lies roughly 420 kilometres north of Sao Paulo.", "Officials in Capitolio \u2014\u00a0which has about 8,400 residents \u2014\u00a0say the town can see around 5,000 visitors on a weekend, and up to 30,000 on holidays.", "Officials suggested the rock wall\u00a0coming loose could have been related to recent heavy rains that caused flooding in the state and forced almost 17,000 people out of their homes.", "Earlier last year, the main concern was a lack of rain as Brazil experienced its\u00a0worst drought in 91 years, forcing\u00a0officials to divert\u00a0the water flow from the Furnas Lake dam.", "The Brazilian navy, which also helped in the rescue, said it would investigate the causes of the accident.", "Even in the dry season, in some parts of the lake the movement is so intense that the boats have to take turns to navigate, said the City Hall press office.", "AP"]
